MetaData.MetaDataItem: MATRIX ZDB5100 is a dimmer wall switch module with four backlit pushbuttons. MATRIX is designed to fit into 1-module FUGA® wall boxes (Danish standard).
MATRIX’add/remove function is initiated by pressing a single time on the smallpushbutton(I) in the middle of the module (under the tangent cover), and the LED’s inpushbutton1 will start blinking.
MATRIX’add/remove function is initiated by pressing a single time on the smallpushbutton(I) in the middle of the module (under the tangent cover), and the LED’s inpushbutton1 will start blinking.
MATRIX can be factory reset by holding the smallpushbutton(I) in the middle of the module under the tangent cover, for at least 10 seconds.

ChangeLog.Entry: Initial Metadata Import from Z-Wave Alliance Database - https://products.z-wavealliance.org/products/3399/xml

Value.label: Operating pushbutton(s) for dimmer
Value.Help: This parameter specifies which pushbutton(s) that shall be used to control the built-in dimmer.

Item.label: No local operation of the dimmer
Pushbutton 1 controls the dimmer
Pushbutton 2 controls the dimmer
Pushbutton 3 controls the dimmer
Pushbutton 4 controls the dimmer

Value.label: Duration of dimming
Value.Help: This parameter specifies the duration ofa full regulation of the light from 0% to 100%. 0: Immediately. 1-127: Durationin seconds (Default is 5 seconds). 128-255: Duration in minutes (minus 127) from 1 –128 minutes, where 128 is 1 minute.

Value.label: Duration of on/off
Value.Help: This parameter specifies the duration when turning the light on or off. 0: Immediately. (Default). 1-127: Time in seconds. 128-255: Time in minutes (minus 127) from 1 –128 minutes, where 128 is 1 minute.

Value.label: Dimmer mode
Value.Help: The dimmer can work in three different modes: on/off, leading edge or trailing edge.

Item.label: No dimming, only on/off (0%/100%)
Trailing edge dimming
Leading edge dimming

Value.label: Dimmer minimum level
Value.Help: This parameter specifies the actual level of the dimmer output when set to 0%.

Value.label: Dimmer maximum level
Value.Help: This parameter specifies the actual level of the dimmer output when set to 99%.

Value.label: Central Scene notifications
Value.Help: This parameter can be used for disabling Central Scene notifications.

Item.label: Notifications are disabled
Notifications are enabled

Value.label: Double-activation functionality
Value.Help: This parameter specifies the reaction when double-activating the pushbuttons.

Item.label: Double-activation disabled
Double-activation sets light to 100%

Value.label: Enhanced LED control
Value.Help: This parameter can be used for enabling the enhanced LED control. See document about MATRIX enhanced LED control.

Item.label: Enhanced LED control is disabled
Enhanced LED control is enabled

Value.label: Pushbutton debounce timer
Value.Help: Pushbutton input debounce time in 0.01 seconds resolution. 1-255: 1–2.55 seconds. Default is 5, which equals to a debounce-filter on 50 milliseconds (0.05 seconds).

Value.label: Pushbutton press threshold time
Value.Help: Specifies the time that apushbuttonmust be activated before it is detected as pressed. Resolution is in 0.01 seconds. 1-255: 1–2.55 seconds. Default is 20, which equals to 200 milliseconds (0.2 seconds).

Value.label: Pushbutton held threshold time
Value.Help: Specifies the time that a pushbutton must have been activated before it is accepted as “held-down”. Resolution is 0.01 seconds. 1-255: 1–2.55 seconds. Default is 50, which equals to 500 milliseconds (0,5 seconds).

Value.label: Global brightness control
Value.Help: Byte 1: Red brightness 0-255 Brightness level for the red colour in the 4 indicator groups (Default is 255). Byte 2: Green brightness 0–255 Brightness level for the green colour in the 4 indicator groups (Default is 255). Byte 3: Blue brightness 0-255 Brightness level for the blue colour in the 4 indicator groups (Default is 255). Byte 4: Not used–must be set to 0. Default: 4294967040

Value.label: Associations groups, transmission when included secure
Value.Help: This parameter specifies if commands are transmitted as a secure message for each of the association groups. Bitmask: 0: All messages in all groups are sent as insecure. 1: Messages in association group 2 aresent as secure. 2: Messages in association group 3 aresent as secure. 4: Messages in association group 4 aresent as secure. 8: Messages in association group 5 aresent as secure. 16: Messages in association group 6 aresent as secure. 32: Messages in association group 7 aresent as secure. 64: Messages in association group 8 aresent as secure. 128: Messages in association group 9 aresent as secure. 256: Messages in association group 10 aresent as secure. 512: Messages in association group 11 aresent as secure. 1024: Messages in association group 12 aresent as secure. 2048: Messages in association group 13 aresent as secure. 4096: Messages in association group 14 aresent as secure. 8191: Messages in allassociation groups are sent as secure. (Default)

BitSet.Label: Bit#0. All commands are sent unencrypted
BitSet.Help: All messages in all groups are sent as insecure.

BitSet.Label: Bit#1. Send Basic Report to association group 2 encrypted.
BitSet.Help: Messages in association group 2 are sent as secure.

BitSet.Label: Bit#2. Send Binary Switch Set to association group 3 encrypted.
BitSet.Help: Messages in association group 3 are sent as secure.

BitSet.Label: Bit#4. Send Multi-LevelSwitch to association group 4 encrypted.
BitSet.Help: Messages in association group 4 are sent as secure.

BitSet.Label: Bit#8. Send Basic Report to association group 5 encrypted.
BitSet.Help: Messages in association group 5 are sent as secure.

BitSet.Label: Bit#16. Send Binary Switch Set to association group 6 encrypted.
BitSet.Help: Messages in association group 6 are sent as secure.

BitSet.Label: Bit#32. Send Multi-LevelSwitch to association group 7 encrypted.
BitSet.Help: Messages in association group 7 are sent as secure.

BitSet.Label: Bit#64. Send Basic Report to association group 8 encrypted.
BitSet.Help: Messages in association group 8 are sent as secure.

BitSet.Label: Bit#128. Send Binary Switch Set to association group 9 encrypted.
BitSet.Help: Messages in association group 9 are sent as secure.

BitSet.Label: Bit#256. Send Multi-LevelSwitch to association group 10 encrypted.
BitSet.Help: Messages in association group 10 are sent as secure.

BitSet.Label: Bit#512. Send Basic Report to association group 11 encrypted.
BitSet.Help: Messages in association group 11 are sent as secure.

BitSet.Label: Bit#1024. Send Binary Switch Set to association group 12 encrypted.
BitSet.Help: Messages in association group 12 are sent as secure.

BitSet.Label: Bit#2048. Send Multi-LevelSwitch to association group 10 encrypted.
BitSet.Help: Messages in association group 13 are sent as secure.

BitSet.Label: Bit#4096. Send Basic Report to association group 14 encrypted.
BitSet.Help: Messages in association group 14 are sent as secure.

BitSet.Label: Bit#8191. All commands are sent encrypted (default).
BitSet.Help: Messages in all association groups are sent as secure.

Value.label: Pushbutton 1 functionality
Value.Help: This parameter specifies the functionality of pushbutton 1.

Item.label: Standard toggle-function, the state is switched between on and off, dimming up and down
Automatic turn off after the time has expired (staircase lighting function), the time is specified in the next configuration parameter
Automatic turn on after the time has expired, the time is specified in the next configuration parameter
Always turn offor dim down. Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send ‘off’ or ‘dim down’ commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 4
Always turn on or dim up. Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send ‘on’ or ‘dim up’ commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 3

Value.label: Timer value for pushbutton 1
Value.Help: 0–43200: Specifies the time in seconds. Default is 300 = 5 minutes.

Value.label: Multi-Level Switch Set values for pushbutton 1
Value.Help: Byte 1: Enable/ Disable 0 Disabled – A single activation of the pushbutton will not send commands to devices in association group 4. 1 Enabled – A single activation will send commands to devices in association group 4. Devices will receive commands with the values set in Byte 2 and 3 (Default). Byte 2: Upper switch value 0–99, 255 When single pressing the pushbutton for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4 (Default = 255). Byte 3: Lower switch value 0-99 When single pressing the pushbutton for OFF, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4 (Default = 0). Byte 4: Not used–must be set to 0. Default: 33488896

Value.label: Binary Switch Setsupport for pushbutton 1
Value.Help: This parameter specifies how received Binary Switch Setcommands are handled.

Item.label: Binary Switch Set - only controls the pushbutton indicator LEDs, ON/OFF
Binary Switch Set - controls the internal switch status and the pushbutton indicator LEDs
Binary Switch Set - is handled as if the user had activated the pushbutton, including transmission of commands via the association groups

Value.label: Pushbutton 1 LED indication
Value.Help: This parameter specifies how the LED indication is controlled..

Item.label: Internal LED control is disabled, only external commands control the indication
The LED indication follows the switch status
The LED indication follows the switch status – with inverted functionality
Same as 1
Same as 2
The LED indication follows the status of the internal dimmer, ON or OFF
The LED indication follows the status of the internal dimmer with inverted functionality, ON or OFF
The LED indicator is ON for 5 seconds when the pushbutton is activated

Value.label: Colour commands for pushbutton 1 LED indication
Value.Help: This parameter specifies how received Binary Switch Set commands are handled.

Item.label: Direct control - the LED indication shows the received colour immediately, until the pushbutton is activated
Colour command sets the colour for OFF indication
Colour command sets the colour for ON indication

Value.label: ON indication RGB-saturation for pushbutton 1
Value.Help: Byte 1: Colour saturation, red 0-255 Specifies the saturation for the red LEDs (Default is 0). Byte 2: Colour saturation, green 0–255 Specifies the saturation for the green LEDs (Default is 0). Byte 3: Colour saturation, blue 0-255 Specifies the saturation for the blue LEDs (Default is 127). Byte 4: LED control 0-255 LED indicator control - see the application note about this parameter (Default is 0). Default: 32512

Value.label: OFF indication RGB-saturation for pushbutton 1
Value.Help: Byte 1: Colour saturation, red 0-255 Specifies the saturation for the red LEDs (Default is 47). Byte 2: Colour saturation, green 0–255 Specifies the saturation for the green LEDs (Default is 47). Byte 3: Colour saturation, blue 0-255 Specifies the saturation for the blue LEDs (Default is 47). Byte 4: LED control 0-255 LED indicator control - see the application note about this parameter (Default is 0). Default: 50065152

Automatic turn on after the time has expired, the time is specified in the next configuration parameter

Always turn on or dim up. Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send ‘on’ or ‘dim up’ commands

Value.Help: 0–43200: Specifies the time in seconds. Default is 300 = 5 minutes.

Devices will receive commands with the values set in Byte 2 and 3 (Default). Byte 2: Upper switch value 0–99, 255 When single pressing the pushbutton for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4 (Default = 255). Byte 3: Lower switch value 0-99 When single pressing the pushbutton for OFF, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4 (Default = 0). Byte 4: Not used–must be set to 0. Default: 33488896

Value.Help: This parameter specifies how received Binary Switch Set commands are handled.

Item.label: Binary Switch Set - only controls the pushbutton indicator LEDs, ON/OFF
Binary Switch Set - controls the internal switch status and the pushbutton indicator LEDs
Binary Switch Set - is handled as if the user had activated the pushbutton, including transmission of commands via the association groups

The LED indication follows the switch status
The LED indication follows the switch status – with inverted functionality

Group.label: Send Basic Report (On/Off) when button #1 is used
Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #1 is used
Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #1 is used
Send Basic Report (On/Off) when button #2 is used
Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #2 is used
Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #2 is used
Send Basic Report (On/Off) when button #3 is used
Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #3 is used
Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #3 is used
Send Basic Report (On/Off) when button #4 is used
Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #4 is used
Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #4 is used
Send Basic Report with information about the actual level for the dimmer
